p: Tampieri et al. [ 10] report in vitro activity of C. flexuosum EO. In our study this EO showed a 2.5% MIC value, confirming this result. L. cubeba EO, characterized by an analogous chemical composition and never tested before, was therefore included in the assay, demonstrating a 2.5% MIC, also. This same value was obtained testing C. bergamia, while further Citrus spp. EOs did not show biological activity. C. limon EO only has been object of interest by other Authors [ 10, 13] resulting ineffective. The unique efficacy of C. bergamia among other species within the genus appears to be very interesting, and it could be explained on the basis of its peculiar chemical composition, characterized by the presence of linalool and linalool acetate, along with a lower amount of limonene, when compared to other Citrus species.
